*insert official embarassment here*

Just as I got your reply, I dug furthe=
r back in the test logs and found a
call to the ImageIcon constructor in th=
e enum static initialization (just as
you predicted.)  The files referenced=
 in the constructor weren't being
copied into the classpath until after the=
 tests were being run (d'oh), thus
the static initialization block threw an=
 exception and future attempts to
load the class threw the NoClassDefFoundE=
rror.

Thanks for your help!
j.

On 10/19/06, C=C3=A9dric Beust =E2=99=94 <=
cbeust@...> wrote:
>
>   On 10/18/06, Jared Warren <jared.warren@gma=
il.com<jared.warren%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> >
> > Yeah, that's certainly w=
hat I thought....
> >
> > But all of my other tests pass, and the classes a=
re all generated by the
> > same compiler call, and the "destdir" is the sa=
me for all of them. (In
> > fact, the stack trace includes classes that are=
 in the same package and
> > directory as the 'enum' that's causing the NoC=
lassDefFoundError to be
> > thrown.
>
> Not sure what else to tell you, exc=
ept to point out that you're looking at
> at NoClassDefFound, and not Class=
NotFound.
>
> NoClassDefFound is typically thrown when a class can't comple=
te its
> initialization (for example, in a static block). Do you have stati=
c
> blocks? Are they referencing external classes?
>
> --
